page.title: 15Clubs and Recreation
page.content: There are a wide variety of activities for both young and old in the area, both organised and self-motivated. For the children there are Brownies, Guides, Cubs, Scouts and Youth Clubs within travelling distance. Some children have their own ponies or horses and can take part in local gymkhanas but there are swimming pools at Corby and Market Harborough plus tennis courts at Medbourne if they or their parents are members. For the older members there are football, cricket, bowls, clay pigeon and gliding clubs in the area plus the usual winter pastimes centred on the pubs of whist, crib, dominoes,bridge, skittles and pool.At Drayton, bingo sessions and whist drives are held in the village hall. In Medbourne the Women's Institute meets monthly and the Autumn Club fortnightly.
